parameters.definition: Number of heart medication pills Lab 1 produces per hour
Number of lung medication pills Lab 1 produces per hour
Number of heart medication pills Lab 2 produces per hour
Number of lung medication pills Lab 2 produces per hour
Number of worker hours per session needed for Lab 1
Number of worker hours per session needed for Lab 2

description: A pharmaceutical company has two labs, Lab 1 and Lab 2, where they make heart and lung medication pills. At Lab 1, they can produce \param{HeartLab1} heart medication pills and \param{LungLab1} lung medication pills per hour. At Lab 2, they can produce \param{HeartLab2} heart medication pills and \param{LungLab2} lung medication pills per hour. Each session at Lab 1 requires \param{WorkerLab1} hours of worker labor, while each session at Lab 2 requires \param{WorkerLab2} hours of worker labor. The company has \param{TotalWorkerHours} worker hours available and must make at least \param{MinHeartPills} heart medication pills and at least \param{MinLungPills} lung medication pills. How many hours at each lab should be run to minimize the total time needed?
